alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 8:55AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk and the northwestern City of Virginia Beach through 930 AM EST... At 855 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bowers Hill, or near Churchland, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Churchland and Cradock around 900 AM EST. Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Regent University, Portsmouth, Ghent and Norfolk NAS around 905 AM EST. Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Kempsville, Norfolk, Norfolk International and Norview around 910 AM EST. Virginia Beach around 920 AM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Greenbrier, South Norfolk, Bayside, Wilroy, Portlock, Wards Corner, Princess Anne Plaza, Huntersville, Deanes and North Virginia Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
